column1: Preheat the oven at 200ºC / 390ºF convection or 220ºC / 430ºF conventional oven.
column2: We put them in the preheated oven (180ºC / 355ºF) for 8 minutes straight from the freezer.
column3: Followed this recipe and they turned out great! I preheated oven (regular oven) to 230 degrees, popped croissants in and immediately turned down to 190 and baked for 10 mins then lowered temp to 170 and baked for another 7 mins.
column4: Adjust oven racks to upper and lower thirds of oven and preheat to 425°F.
column5: Preheat your oven to 400 F degrees.
column6: Towards the end of the rise time, preheat the oven to 425°F.
column7: Preheat the oven to 190 °C (convection) for 20 minutes.
column8: Once ready to bake, preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (22o degrees C) .
column9: Brush with egg: Preheat oven to 400 degrees, with racks in upper and lower thirds.
column11: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F, and gently brush the croissants with egg wash.
column13: Position oven racks in the upper and lower thirds of the oven and preheat to 425 degrees F.
column14:
Preheat your oven to 400 
degrees (200 degrees C).
column15: Twenty minutes before baking, preheat your oven to 400 degrees F (220 degrees C).
column16: If the room is colder preheat your oven to 150, turn it off, and the oven should  register at 26 degrees C/ 80 degrees F.
column17: Preheat the oven to 218 to 232 degrees C/ 425 degrees F, arrange the oven racks so one rack to the lower and upper positions.
column18: Preheat the oven to 200C for 30 mins or until it comes up to temperature.
column19: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
column20: Remove croissants from the oven and preheat to 375°F (190°C).
column23: Place the croissants on a baking tray and heat in a preheated oven (180°C, gas mark 4) for 5 minutes.
column28: Preheat your oven to 180 degrees C and bake for 15-20 minutes.
column30: For the croissants: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
column34: In the morning, preheat the oven to 200 degrees Celsius Fan-bake or 220 degrees Celsius at regular bake.
column35: After one hour position a rack in the middle of the oven and preheat to 425 degrees F.
column36: Place your tray on the counter and preheat your oven to 350 degrees.
column37: Towards the end of rise time, preheat the oven to 375°F.
column41: Bake in the preheated oven at 190C (fan oven on) for 6 minutes, then lower the temperature to 170C for another 10 minutes.
column42: Preheat oven to 200 degrees celsius and bake croissants for 15-20 minutes or until golden.
column43: When ready to bake, arrange your oven racks on your lower and upper third of your oven,  preheat oven to 400 degrees.
column44: Preheat your oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit and bake them for 5 minutes or until they’re slightly firm and crispy.
column46: Meanwhile, position racks in the center and top third of the oven and preheat to 375°F (190°C).
column47: Bake in a preheated oven for 13-15 minutes at 200F.
column48: Preheat the oven at 200 C/ 392 F.
column49: Preheat the oven at 200 C/ 392 F.
column52: Bake in a preheated convection oven at 350°F for 15 - 20 minutes.
column53: With the rack in the middle position, preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
